content:
the native americans give away most of ohio, indiana, illinois, michigan
they gave away most of the northwest territory
this was in exchange for $20,000 and $9,000/yr

they thought that by signing this treaty, they would get recognized as a foreign power because foreign powers sign treaties and not states, towns, cities, etc.
however, this was never the case; it codified the imbalance of power and it made an illegal distinction that was not in favor of the natives
	they were never recognized as a foreign body
